comment: Her topics for the essays and the class overall is fairly easy, but she constantly counts off for nothing on the essays even when providing valid reasoning. You are not allowed to speak in her class or use your phone for any resources. She will fail you for the day if you use your phone. There is also a lot of reading she assigns after every class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Professor Newton is a great instructor. Her expectations and instructions are clear, but you do have to work for a good grade. She is very understanding and helpful if you talk to her. Great professor!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Three major papers. Get ready to write.  Great feedback for final copy. Awesome teacher. Learned a lot.

Ms. Newton was a fantastic instructor, and I thoroughly enjoyed her class. She is more than happy to answer your questions regarding assignments, she gives quality feedback, and she is a fair grader. There are frequent quizzes, but they are easy if you read the assigned material. All things considered, this is a course that I highly recommend.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Clear grading criteria

comment: June Newton is a great professor. I would recommend her highly as she is very kinda and respectable. Throughout the semester I received good feedback and positive criticism only
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES

comment: Ms. Newton is the best professor ever!! She is very nice and understanding when it comes to assignments. She gives good feedback and encourages you to find your style in writing. There are pop quizzes but they're not hard... just read! Take notes and you can use them on the quizzes! Take this class if you want to improve your writing.

She's a great teacher. There are 2 books, but you really only NEED one of them. She will occasionally give pop quizzes over the book that are usually hit or miss. If you just read the chapters and maybe take notes, they'll be a breeze. She's tough when grading the essays, but she will always help you and give great feed back. I'd recommend her.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Very nice lady, but I often found myself dozing off in class. The difficulty and workload is pretty standard for an English class. However, sometimes she assigns some very dull topics for essays so it's rather tempting to procrastinate. Just get your work done before the day it's due and she'll grade you pretty easily.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Caring

comment: Newton is a fantastic teacher and is a student herself currently working towards her masters so she understands the struggles we face. She's a fair grader and assigns interesting writing assignments of which there is only 4 and no final exam or group projects. She cares about your success as a writer and as a student; she's a super sweet lady.
Very tough grader. I've always made A's on papers and I got a 72 on a paper this semester.

Such a sweet lady, and she clearly cares about what she's teaching. Only 4 writing projects throughout the semester, and they have low page requirements. She gives good feedback, and isn't a tough grader. If you're a good writer, you'll most likely get an A on every paper. She assigns some reading throughout the semester, but it's always short.

Newton was one of the most helpful professor's I had. She offers feedback on every paper, of which there are only four. She really tries to make sure that everyone is able to make the best grade they can. The assignments are interesting and give you plenty of room to be creative. Would definitely take again.

Newton was exceptional. Such a sweet lady always willing to help or give constructive feedback about your writing. Only assigns 4 papers for entire semester with low page requirements. Assigns a lot of reading in textbooks, but it's interesting. Assignments are fun and allow you to be creative. Awesome class if you like reading and writing.
